ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: introduction to black british art and culture
Critical thinking in relation to visual art and the sociocultural context in which it was made. The class also added an arsenal of British artists and their work into my realm of reference
Ways of analyzing art, evidence of history demonstrated in changing trends in the content of art, knowledge of various Black British artists

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course was excellently prepared, and I felt like the material was presented in both a logical and engaging way, but I think discussion could have been better serviced had more students had greater ability and familiarity with the formal elements of some of the pieces we discussed. Because many were not art history majors and/or had not taken art history courses before (myself included) I felt the discussions weren't as dynamic as they could have been.
Strengths: learn a lot, seminar setting which helps discussions Weaknesses: no feedback on writing through the semester, but were blog posts so i guess feedback not needed?

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If interested in the topic, definitely a necessary class to take. Interesting cross over of Af Am and Art History
Yes, I would. Gives you insights into both the historical context of black life in the UK and a good survey of the works produced by black artist there in the last sixty years.
yes! very interesting, especially learning about how Black British art has changed through the decades
